intro.p: A recent research study was conducted to find out how likely it was that people who had a case of COVID-19 would have a long-term health complication, commonly called Long-COVID. Researchers from the Luxemborg Institute of Health studied {{sample}} patients who had COVID-19 to see whether they had any of 64 common long COVID symptoms 1 year after they tested positive. Of the patients studied, {{result}}\% {{outcome}}.

What is the variable used for this study?

outtro.p: What, if any, symptoms of long COVID did a person still have a year after getting COVID-19?

outtro.p: The parameter of interest is what percentage of COVID-19 survivors {{outcome}} a year after getting COVID-19.
